p: Proteome profiling resulted in 79,046 spectra, 18,737 peptides, 16,670 unique peptides, and 4312 proteins being identified in masson pine. The detailed information on mass spectrometry collection and identification are shown in Table S1. Most of the peptides were comprised of 7â€“20 amino acids, which is within the ranges of proteome quality requirements [ 54] ( Figure S1).
